newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai Danu, FinOne scrap merger.
newsitem.headline: Thai Danu, FinOne scrap merger.

text.p: Thai Danu Bank Plc and Finance One Plc on Friday agreed to scrap a planned merger, a senior Thai Danu official said.

Thai Danu senior vice president Khan Prachuabmoh told reporters: "We both agreed to cancel and terminate (efforts) of merging our companies in accordance with the memorandum of understanding signed on March 14."
Thai Danu and Finance One were scheduled to announce progress of their alliance talks later on Friday.
The Bank of Thailand has strived to facilitate the merger of the two firms in the hope of making it a model for other smaller finance companies to consolidate through similar alliances.
The banks and finance companies have been under pressure from a glut of real estate, outstanding debt and the country's slowing economy which have combined to depress investor sentiment.

Deputy central bank governor Jaroong Nookhwun said earlier on Friday the Bank of Thailand was prepared to contain any damage that the finance sector may face from a collapse of the Thai Danu-Finance One talks.
He said the authorities would be ready to shore up cash-strapped Finance One by helping it raise capital. He did not elaborate.
Finance One, Thailand's biggest finance company, is among companies saddled with large non-performing property loans.
